bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, adopting regulation means the Railway Safety Adopted Provisions Regulation, B.C. Reg. 210/2004.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delegation to British Columbia Safety Authority

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 2 and 6 of the Railway Safety Act, the administration of the Railway Safety Act is delegated to the British Columbia Safety Authority, except for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sections 3, 11, 12 and 20 and Parts 4 and 5, and
section 19 (0.1) of the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board Act, adopted by section 5 of the adopting regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), the administration of provisions that is otherwise delegated by this regulation is not delegated to the British Columbia Safety Authority.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delegation to the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board

bcl:definition.bcl:text: board means the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board established by section 4 of the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board Act;
common carrier means a railway that is neither a commuter railway nor an industrial railway;
commuter railway means a railway operated by or on behalf of the Greater Vancouver Transportation Authority to transport passengers for a toll or fee;
industrial railway means a railway authorized by a permit under section 11 of the Railway Safety Act to operate as an industrial railway.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 1, the administration of the following provisions is delegated to the board:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provisions of the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board Act adopted by section 5 of the adopting regulation, except for section 23 (1) of that Act;
the provisions of the Transportation Safety Board Regulations, SOR/2014-37, adopted by section 6 of the adopting regulation, except for section 5 of those regulations;
section 5 of the Transportation Safety Board Regulations, SOR/2014-37, but only with respect to common carriers.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delegation to the Canadian Transportation Agency

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, agency means the Canadian Transportation Agency continued by section 7 (1) of the Canada Transportation Act.
Subject to sections 1 and 2, the administration of the following provisions is delegated to the agency:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provisions of the Canada Transportation Act adopted by section 7 of the adopting regulation;
sections 16 (1), (3), (4), (4.1) and (6) and sections 26 (1), (3) and (4) of the Railway Safety Act (Canada), adopted by section 3 of the adopting regulation.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Railway Safety Act, S.B.C. 2004, c. 8, ss. 6 and 22.]
